NewsDetail.subTitle: How do I Create that “student” experience being so far away?
NewsDetail.Abstract: BYU-Idaho has several communities and groups for you to be a part of as a distant online student. If you are not satisfied with the offerings, let us know and we will point you in the right direction.
NewsDetail.Author: Izzy Baker
NewsDetail.BodyCopy:
Online Community Webpage: Think of this link as a concierge service of portfolio options for you to get involved. Check it out. http://www.byui.edu/online/community. 

BYU-Idaho Pathway and Online Programs the official Facebook fan page: Check out what the Pathway and Online Programs have to say. https://www.facebook.com/BYUIdahoOnline?ref=tn_tnmn   

BYU-Idaho Online Student Support Group: This group is to help you feel connected to each other as students and to campus, a place for you to hang out and interact with one another. Feel free to jump in, ask questions or just get involved. Join our group today: https://www.facebook.com/groups/117459058406301/    

BYU-Idaho Pathway Speaking Partners Facebook Page: See what is going on for Speaking Partners around the world. Feel free to comment, share your experiences, ask questions or get involved. https://www.facebook.com/PathwaySpeakingPartners?fref=ts  

Pathway Site Facebook Pages: Check out this link for a listing of individual Pathway site Facebook pages. Find yours. If it isn't there, start one and let us know so we can post it on this page. http://www.byui.edu/online/community/facebook-pages    

BYU-Idaho campus affiliated Facebook pages: For a listing of facebook pages affiliated with BYU-Idaho:  http://www.byui.edu/social-media/facebook/?cid=fli:186
